results.title: The Amazing Bone (K)
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Michael Sporn Animation and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Pearl the pig finds a magic talking bone. On the way home the bone scares off a band of muggers, but does not fair as well with a debonair fox. Although Pearl and the talking bone so live happily ever after.

results.title: The Amazing bone
results.brief_description: Pearl, a lively young pig, touched by spring, happens upon a talking bone that belonged to a witch. The bone scares off a band of muggers, but does not fare as well with the debonair fox. From a book by William Steig.

results.title: The Amazing adventures of Mr. Bean
results.brief_description: Two episodes of the popular television series starring Rowan Atkinson. In the first episode “Mr. Bean” he experiences every students worst nightmare - sitting for an exam in which you don’t know any of the answers. He then experiences every beachgoers’ nightmare - being on a beach with other people and nowhere to change. Finally he experiences every churchgoers nightmare - a general lack of concentration. His solutions to these problems must be seen to be believed. “The return of Mr. Bean” sees him shopping with his American Express Card. Together, these episodes provide the ideal instruction manual for would-be idiots everywhere. Includes material not previously seen on television.

results.title: The Amazing adventures of Morph
results.brief_description: Morph, the favourite children’s TV character is back on your screen! The little clay man from Tony Hart’s art studio appears on video with thirteen of his best adventures ever. Join in the fun with Morph, the troublesome Chas, the geriatric skateboarder Grand Morph, the two girls Folly and Delilah, the gentle giant Gillespie, Nailbrush - who thinks he’s a dog, and the helpful tribe of ‘very small creatures’. The legend of Morph lives on, in over 55 minutes of fun. Narrated by Tony Hart.

results.title: The Amazing adventure
results.brief_description: Cary Grant returned to England to make “The Amazing adventure” one of the few films he made outside of Hollywood in the 1930s. Grant plays Ernest Bliss, a man who is independently wealthy due to an inheritance but whose life lacks meaning. Suffering a type of depression exclusive to the idle rich, Bliss consults a doctor who wages Bliss 50,000 pounds that he can’t last a year earning his own keep. Bliss determines to meet the challenge and sets off in search of employment. Depression era London proves to be a tough life for Bliss, whose experiences over the year shape him significantly. The bet is set awry when Bliss meets Frances - a woman being forced to marry for money despite her reciprocated love for Bliss. The film adheres to the Depression formula of a man who renounces his wealth in order to experience life first hand and learn lessons of good-hearted common people. This version is the 62-minute American release. Also starring Mary Brian, Peter Gawthorne, and Henry Kendall. Based on the book by English novelist E. Phillips Oppenheimer.

results.title: The amateurist
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A short, captivating video about surveillance, identity, watching and being watched. ‘The Amateurist’ slides along the edges of horror and satire to create an unsettling portrait of a woman on the brink of a technologically-driven madness.

results.title: The Amateur gentleman
results.creator_credit: Thornton Freeland, Hal Roach, Douglas Fairbanks, Marcel Hellman, Criterion Films and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film takes place in 1810 England. The hero is Barnaby Barty (Douglas Fairbanks Jr), son of a country innkeeper who is wrongly accused of theft during a visit from Royalty - the Marquis of Camberhurst and his son, Lord Chichester (Basil Sydney). To prove his dad innocent of a crime, Barnaby poses as a famous bare-knuckle gentleman prizefighter. He travels to London and gets involved with London society, royalty, murder and intrigue in his quest to save his father. Based on a novel of the same title by Jeffrey Farnol. Cast includes: Elissa Landi, Margaret Lockwood, Coral Browne, Irene Browne, Gilbert Davis, Gordon Harker, Esme Percy, Frank Pettingell, Athole Stewart and Hugh Williams. Cinematographer: Gunther Krampf.

results.title: The Aluminium age
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg, Comalco and Scope Films
results.brief_description: Describes the three steps involved in the making of aluminium; mining bauxite, separating the alumina from impurities, and finally the removal of the oxygen from alumina. The many and varied uses of aluminium are also illustrated. Music by Rory O’Donoghue and Grahame Bond. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: The Alternatives to Infertility
results.brief_description: In this program, the various methods of treatment that are available to infertile couples are listed. The aim of the program is to teach both patients and the community at large about current reproductive technology. The issues of ethics, morality and legality are not discussed.
